info.title: Market Data API
info.description: Access real-time and historical market data for US equities, options, crypto, and foreign exchange data through the Alpaca REST and WebSocket APIs. There are APIs for Stock Pricing, Option Pricing, Crypto Pricing, Forex, Logos, Fixed income, Corporate Actions, Screener, and News.

license.name: Creative Commons Attribution Share Alike 4.0 International

tags.name: Logos
tags.description: Endpoints for getting company logo images.

tags.name: Screener
tags.description: Endpoints for most active stocks and top movers.

tags.name: News
tags.description: Endpoints for getting news articles about the stock market.

get.description:
This endpoint provides data about the corporate actions for each given symbol over a specified time period.

> ⚠️ Warning
>
> Currently Alpaca has no guarantees on the creation time of corporate actions. There may be delays in receiving corporate actions from our data providers, and there may be delays in processing and making them available via this API. As a result, corporate actions may not be available immediately after they are announced.
This endpoint returns the latest prices for the given fixed income securities.
Get the latest forex rates for the given currency pairs.
Get historical forex rates for the given currency pairs in the given time interval and at the given timeframe (snapshot frequency).
Get the image of the company logo for the given symbol.

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of symbols for which to query news.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit of news items to be returned for a result page.

parameters.name: include_content
parameters.description: Boolean indicator to include content for news articles (if available).

parameters.name: exclude_contentless
parameters.description: Boolean indicator to exclude news articles that do not contain content.

news.headline: Apple Leader in Phone Sales in China for Second Straight Month in November With 23.6% Share, According to Market Research Data
news.author: Charles Gross
news.summary: This headline-only article is meant to show you why a stock is moving, the most difficult aspect of stock trading
news.content: This headline-only article is meant to show you why a stock is moving, the most difficult aspect of stock trading....

get.description: Returns the latest news articles across stocks and crypto. By default, returns the latest 10 news articles.

The historical option bars API provides aggregates for a list of option symbols between the specified dates.

The returned results are sorted by symbol first, then by bar timestamp.
This means that you are likely to see only one symbol in your first response if there are enough bars for that symbol to hit the limit you requested.

In these situations, if you keep requesting again with the `next_page_token` from the previous response, you will eventually reach the other symbols if any bars were found for them.
Returns the mapping between the condition codes and names.
Returns the mapping between the option exchange codes and the corresponding exchanges names.
The latest multi-quotes endpoint provides the latest bid and ask prices for each given contract symbol.
The snapshots endpoint provides the latest trade, latest quote and greeks for each given contract symbol.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter contracts by the type (call or put).

parameters.name: strike_price_gte
parameters.description: Filter contracts with strike price greater than or equal to the specified value.

parameters.name: strike_price_lte
parameters.description: Filter contracts with strike price less than or equal to the specified value.

parameters.name: expiration_date
parameters.description: Filter contracts by the exact expiration date (format: YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: expiration_date_gte
parameters.description: Filter contracts with expiration date greater than or equal to the specified date.

parameters.name: expiration_date_lte
parameters.description: Filter contracts with expiration date less than or equal to the specified date.

parameters.name: root_symbol
parameters.description: Filter contracts by the root symbol.

get.description: The option chain endpoint provides the latest trade, latest quote, and greeks for each contract symbol of the underlying symbol.

The historical option trades API provides trade data for a list of contract symbols between the specified dates.

The returned results are sorted by symbol first then by trade timestamp.
This means that you are likely to see only one symbol in your first response if there are enough trades for that symbol to hit the limit you requested.

In these situations, if you keep requesting again with the `next_page_token` from the previous response, you will eventually reach the other symbols if any trades were found for them.
The latest multi-trades endpoint provides the latest historical trade data for multiple given contract symbols.
Returns the most active stocks by volume or trade count based on real time SIP data. By default, returns the top 10 symbols by volume.

Returns the top market movers (gainers and losers) based on real time SIP data.
The change for each symbol is calculated from the previous closing price and the latest closing price.

For stocks, the endpoint resets at market open. Until then, it shows the previous market day's movers.
The data is split-adjusted. Only tradable symbols in exchanges are included.

For crypto, the endpoint resets at midnight.
The latest bars endpoint returns the latest bar data for the crypto perpetual futures symbols provided.
The latest futures pricing endpoint returns the latest pricing data for the crypto perpetual futures symbols provided.
The latest orderbook endpoint returns the latest bid and ask orderbook for the crypto perpetual futures symbols provided.
The latest quotes endpoint returns the latest bid and ask prices for the crypto perpetual futures symbols provided.
The latest trades endpoint returns the latest trade data for the crypto perpetual futures symbols provided.
The crypto bars API provides historical aggregates for a list of crypto symbols between the specified dates.
The latest multi-bars endpoint returns the latest minute-aggregated historical bar data for each of the crypto symbols provided.
The latest orderbook endpoint returns the latest bid and ask orderbook for the crypto symbols provided.
The latest quotes endpoint returns the latest bid and ask prices for the crypto symbols provided.
The latest trades endpoint returns the latest trade data for the crypto symbols provided.

The crypto quotes API provides historical quote data for a list of crypto symbols between the specified dates.
The oldest date to retrieve historical quotes of us-1 location is 14th October, 2025 12AM UTC.
The snapshots endpoint returns the latest trade, latest quote, latest minute bar, latest daily bar, and previous daily bar data for crypto symbols.
The crypto trades API provides historical trade data for a list of crypto symbols between the specified dates.
The historical auctions endpoint provides auction prices for a list of stock symbols between the specified dates.

The historical stock bars API provides aggregates for a list of stock symbols between the specified dates.

The returned results are sorted by symbol first, then by bar timestamp. This means that you are likely to see only one symbol in your first response if there are enough bars for that symbol to hit the limit you requested.

In these situations, if you keep requesting again with the `next_page_token` from the previous response, you will eventually reach the other symbols if any bars were found for them.
The latest bars endpoint provides the latest minute bar for the given ticker symbols.

parameters.name: tape
parameters.description: The one character name of the tape.

get.description: Returns the mapping between the condition codes and names.
Returns the mapping between the stock exchange codes and the corresponding exchanges names.

The historical stock quotes API provides quote data for a list of stock symbols between the specified dates.

The returned results are sorted by symbol first, then by the quote timestamp. This means that you are likely to see only one symbol in your first response if there are enough quotes for that symbol to hit the limit you requested.

In these situations, if you keep requesting again with the `next_page_token` from the previous response, you will eventually reach the other symbols if any quotes were found for them.
The latest quotes endpoint provides the latest best bid and ask prices for the given ticker symbols.
The snapshot endpoint for multiple tickers provides the latest trade, latest quote, minute bar, daily bar, and previous daily bar data for each given ticker symbol.

The historical stock trades API provides trade data for a list of stock symbols between the specified dates.

The returned results are sorted by symbol first then by trade timestamp. This means that you are likely to see only one symbol in your first response if there are enough trades for that symbol to hit the limit you requested.

In these situations, if you keep requesting again with the `next_page_token` from the previous response, you will eventually reach the other symbols if any trades were found for them.

The latest trades endpoint provides the latest trades for the given ticker symbols.

Trades with any conditions that causes them to not update the bar price are excluded. For example a trade with condition `I` (odd lot) will never appear on this endpoint. You can find the complete list of excluded conditions in [this FAQ](https://docs.alpaca.markets/docs/market-data-faq#how-are-bars-aggregated).
The historical auctions endpoint provides auction prices for the given stock symbol between the specified dates.
The historical stock bars API provides aggregates for the stock symbol between the specified dates.
The latest bar endpoint returns the latest minute bar for the given ticker symbol.
The historical stock quotes API provides quote data for a stock symbol between the specified dates.
The latest quote endpoint provides the latest best bid and ask prices for a given ticker symbol.
The snapshot endpoint provides the latest trade, latest quote, minute bar, daily bar, and previous daily bar data for a given ticker symbol.
The historical stock trades API provides trade data for a stock symbol between the specified dates.

The latest trade endpoint provides the latest trade for the given ticker symbol.

Trades with any conditions that causes them to not update the bar price are excluded. For example a trade with condition `I` (odd lot) will never appear on this endpoint. You can find the complete list of excluded conditions in [this FAQ](https://docs.alpaca.markets/docs/market-data-faq#how-are-bars-aggregated).

cas_types.name: types
cas_types.description:
A comma-separated list of types. If not provided, search all types.

The following types are supported:
  - reverse_split
  - forward_split
  - unit_split
  - cash_dividend
  - stock_dividend
  - spin_off
  - cash_merger
  - stock_merger
  - stock_and_cash_merger
  - redemption
  - name_change
  - worthless_removal
  - rights_distribution

cas_start.name: start
cas_start.description: The inclusive start of the interval. The corporate actions are sorted by their `process_date`. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Default: current day.

cas_end.name: end
cas_end.description: The inclusive end of the interval. The corporate actions are sorted by their `process_date`. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Default: current day.

cas_ids.name: ids
cas_ids.description: A comma-separated list of corporate action IDs. This parameter is mutually exclusive with all other filters (symbols, types, start, end).

cas_limit.name: limit
cas_limit.description:
Maximum number of corporate actions to return in a response.
The limit applies to the total number of data points, not the count per symbol!
Use `next_page_token` to fetch the next set of corporate actions.

page_token.name: page_token
page_token.description: The pagination token from which to continue. The value to pass here is returned in specific requests when more data is available, usually because of a response result limit.

sort.name: sort
sort.description: Sort data in ascending or descending order.

isins.name: isins
isins.description: A comma-separated list of ISINs with a limit of 1000.

start.name: start
start.description:
The inclusive start of the interval. Format: RFC-3339 or YYYY-MM-DD.
Default: the beginning of the current day, but at least 15 minutes ago if the user doesn't have real-time access for the feed.

end.name: end
end.description:
The inclusive end of the interval. Format: RFC-3339 or YYYY-MM-DD.
Default: the current time if the user has a real-time access for the feed, otherwise 15 minutes before the current time.

limit.name: limit
limit.description:
The maximum number of data points to return in the response page.
The API may return less, even if there are more available data points in the requested interval.
Always check the `next_page_token` for more pages.
The limit applies to the total number of data points, not per symbol!

symbol.name: symbol
symbol.description: A unique series of letters assigned to a security for trading purposes.

option_symbols.name: symbols
option_symbols.description: A comma-separated list of contract symbols with a limit of 100.

timeframe.name: timeframe
timeframe.description:
The timeframe represented by each bar in aggregation.
You can use any of the following values:
 - `[1-59]Min` or `[1-59]T`, e.g. `5Min` or `5T` creates 5-minute aggregations
 - `[1-23]Hour` or `[1-23]H`, e.g. `12Hour` or `12H` creates 12-hour aggregations
 - `1Day` or `1D` creates 1-day aggregations
 - `1Week` or `1W` creates 1-week aggregations
 - `[1,2,3,4,6,12]Month` or `[1,2,3,4,6,12]M`, e.g. `3Month` or `3M` creates 3-month aggregations

option_feed.name: feed
option_feed.description: The source feed of the data. `opra` is the official OPRA feed, `indicative` is a free indicative feed where trades are delayed and quotes are modified. Default: `opra` if the user has a subscription, otherwise `indicative`.

option_updated_since.name: updated_since
option_updated_since.description:
Filter to snapshots that were updated since this timestamp, meaning that the timestamp of the trade or the quote is greater than or equal to this value.
Format: RFC-3339 or YYYY-MM-DD. If missing, all values are returned.

option_limit.name: limit
option_limit.description:
Number of maximum snapshots to return in a response.
The limit applies to the total number of data points, not the number per symbol!
Use `next_page_token` to fetch the next set of responses.

option_underlying_symbol.name: underlying_symbol
option_underlying_symbol.description: The financial instrument on which an option contract is based or derived.

most_actives_by.name: by
most_actives_by.description: The metric used for ranking the most active stocks.

most_actives_top.name: top
most_actives_top.description: The number of top most active stocks to fetch per day.

movers_top.name: top
movers_top.description: Number of top market movers to fetch (gainers and losers). Will return this number of results for each. By default, 10 gainers and 10 losers.

crypto_perp_symbols.name: symbols
crypto_perp_symbols.description: A comma-separated list of crypto symbols.

crypto_historical_loc.name: loc
crypto_historical_loc.description:
Crypto location from where the historical market data is retrieved.
- `us`: Alpaca US
- `us-1`: Kraken US
- `eu-1`: Kraken EU

crypto_symbols.name: symbols
crypto_symbols.description: A comma-separated list of crypto symbols.

crypto_latest_loc.name: loc
crypto_latest_loc.description:
Crypto location from where the latest market data is retrieved.
- `us`: Alpaca US
- `us-1`: Kraken US
- `eu-1`: Kraken EU

stock_symbols.name: symbols
stock_symbols.description: A comma-separated list of stock symbols.

stock_asof.name: asof
stock_asof.description:
The as-of date of the queried stock symbol(s). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Default: current day.

This date is used to identify the underlying entity of the provided symbol(s), so that name changes for this entity can be found. Data for past symbol(s) is returned if the query date range spans the name change.

The special value of "-" means symbol mapping is skipped. Data is returned based on the symbol alone without looking up previous names. The same happens if the queried symbol is not found on the given `asof` date.

Example: FB was renamed to META in 2022-06-09. Querying META with an `asof` date after 2022-06-09 will also yield FB data. The data for the FB ticker will be labeled as META because they are considered the same underlying entity as of 2022-06-09. Querying FB with an `asof` date after 2022-06-09 will only return data with the FB ticker, not with META. But with an `asof` date before 2022-06-09, META will also be returned (as FB).

stock_currency.name: currency
stock_currency.description: The currency of all prices in ISO 4217 format. Default: USD.

stock_adjustment.name: adjustment
stock_adjustment.description:
Specifies the adjustments for the bars.

 - `raw`: no adjustments
 - `split`: adjust price and volume for forward and reverse stock splits
 - `dividend`: adjust price for cash dividends
 - `spin-off`: adjust price for spin-offs
 - `all`: apply all above adjustments

You can combine multiple adjustments by separating them with a comma, e.g. `split,spin-off`.

stock_historical_feed.name: feed
stock_historical_feed.description:
The source feed of the data.
 - `sip`: all US exchanges
 - `iex`: Investors EXchange
 - `boats`: Blue Ocean ATS, overnight US trading data
 - `otc`: over-the-counter exchanges

stock_latest_feed.name: feed
stock_latest_feed.description:
The source feed of the data.

 - `sip`: all US exchanges
 - `iex`: Investors EXchange
 - `delayed_sip`: SIP with a 15 minute delay
 - `boats`: Blue Ocean, overnight US trading data
 - `overnight`: derived overnight US trading data
 - `otc`: over-the-counter exchanges

Default: `sip` if the user has the unlimited subscription, otherwise `iex`.

sort.description: Sort data in ascending or descending order.

ca_id.description: The internal Alpaca identifier of the corporate action.

process_date.description: The date when the corporate action is processed by Alpaca.

ex_date.description: The ex-date marks the cutoff point for shareholders to be credited.

effective_date.description: The effective date marks the cutoff point for shareholders to be credited.

next_page_token.description: Pagination token for the next page.

timestamp.description: Timestamp in RFC-3339 format with nanosecond precision.

fixed_income_price.description: The price of the instrument as a percentage of its par value.

forex_currency_pairs.description: A comma-separated string with currency pairs.

forex_rate.description: A foreign exchange rate between two currencies at a given time.

bp.description: The last bid price value of the currency at the end of the timeframe.

mp.description: The last mid price value of the currency at the end of the timeframe.

ap.description: The last ask price value of the currency at the end of the timeframe.

forex_latest_rates_resp.description: The response object of the latest forex rates.

forex_timeframe.description:
The sampling interval of the currency rates. For example, 5S returns forex rates sampled every five seconds.
You can use the following values:
 - `5Sec` or `5S`
 - `1Min` or `1T`
 - `1Day` or `1D`

news_image.description: A model representing images for a news article. Simply a URL to the image along with a size parameter suggesting the display size of the image.

size.description: Possible values for size are thumb, small and large.

url.description: URL to image from news article.

headline.description: Headline or title of the article.

summary.description: Summary text for the article (may be first sentence of content).

content.description: Content of the news article (might contain HTML).

images.description: List of images (URLs) related to given article (may be empty).

symbols.description: List of related or mentioned symbols.

source.description: Source where the news originated from (e.g. Benzinga).

option_bar.description: OHLC aggregate of all the trades in a given interval.

example.a: SLAN - Single Leg Auction Non ISO

option_quote.description: The best bid and ask information for a given option.

option_greeks.description: The greeks for the contract calculated using the Black-Scholes model.

option_snapshot.description: A snapshot provides the latest trade and latest quote.

impliedVolatility.description: Implied volatility calculated using the Black-Scholes model.

most_active.description: A stock that is most active by either volume or trade count.

volume.description: Cumulative volume for the current trading day.

trade_count.description: Cumulative trade count for the current trading day.

most_actives.description: List of top N most active symbols.

last_updated.description: Time when the most actives were last computed. Formatted as a RFC-3339 date-time with nanosecond precision.

mover.title: Mover
mover.description: A symbol whose price moved significantly.

percent_change.description: Percentage difference change for the day.

change.description: Difference in change for the day.

price.description: Current price of market moving asset.

last_updated.description: Time when the movers were last computed. Formatted as a RFC-3339 date-time with nanosecond precision.

crypto_bar.description: OHLC aggregate of all the trades in a given interval.

crypto_orderbook_entry.description: A single entry in a crypto orderbook.

crypto_quote.description: The best bid and ask information for a given security.

tks.description: Taker side: B for buyer, S for seller

crypto_historical_loc.description: Crypto location from where the historical market data is retrieved.

crypto_latest_loc.description: Crypto location from where the latest market data is retrieved.

crypto_snapshot.description: A snapshot provides the latest trade, latest quote, latest minute bar, latest daily bar and previous daily bar.

x.description: Exchange code. See `v2/stocks/meta/exchanges` for more details.

c.description: The condition flag indicating that this is an auction. See `v2/stocks/meta/conditions/trade` for more details.

stock_daily_auctions.description: Opening and closing auction prices for a given day.

c.description: Closing auctions. Every price / exchange / condition triplet is only shown once, with its earliest timestamp.

stock_bar.description: OHLC aggregate of all the trades in a given interval.

stock_tape.description:
- A: New York Stock Exchange
- B: NYSE Arca, Bats, IEX and other regional exchanges
- C: NASDAQ
- N: Overnight
- O: OTC

stock_quote.description: The best bid and ask information for a given security.

bx.description: Bid exchange. See `v2/stocks/meta/exchanges` for more details.

bp.description: Bid price. 0 means the security has no active bid.

bs.description: Bid size in shares (round lots prior to November 3, 2025).

ax.description: Ask exchange. See `v2/stocks/meta/exchanges` for more details.

ap.description: Ask price. 0 means the security has no active ask.

as.description: Ask size in shares (round lots prior to November 3, 2025).

c.description: Condition flags. See `v2/stocks/meta/conditions/quote` for more details. If the array contains one flag, it applies to both the bid and ask. If the array contains two flags, the first one applies to the bid and the second one to the ask.

x.description: Exchange code. See `v2/stocks/meta/exchanges` for more details.

i.description: Trade ID sent by the exchange.

c.description: Condition flags. See `v2/stocks/meta/conditions/trade` for more details.

u.description:
Update to the trade. This field is optional, if it's missing, the trade is valid. Otherwise, it can have these values:
 - canceled: indicates that the trade has been canceled
 - incorrect: indicates that the trade has been corrected and the given trade is no longer valid
 - corrected: indicates that this trade is the correction of a previous (incorrect) trade

stock_snapshot.description: A snapshot provides the latest trade, latest quote, latest minute bar, current daily bar and previous daily bar.

ratelimit_reset.description: The UNIX epoch when the remaining quota changes.

400.description: One of the request parameters is invalid. See the returned message for details.

401.description: Authentication headers are missing or invalid. Make sure you authenticate your request with a valid API key.

429.description: Too many requests. You hit the rate limit. Use the X-RateLimit-... response headers to make sure you're under the rate limit.

500.description: Internal server error. We recommend retrying these later. If the issue persists, please contact us on [Slack](https://alpaca.markets/slack) or on the [Community Forum](https://forum.alpaca.markets/).
